title: Lopas Supremacy
report:
Welcome back to the Jart Report after a week twelve filled with some very low scores and some added clarity as we approach the playoffs. With The Family in shambles, we are curious to dive into this week and see what we have learned.

Week Twelve Recap

Team Ross vs NN:

Prediction: NN by 9.3

Reality: NN by 18.78

“No comment at this time” - Aross

“Good dub Aross” - NN

I Got a Half Chubb vs Pray For Ridley:

Prediction: I Got a Half Chubb by 21.3

Reality: I Got a Half Chubb by 8.24

“GG CJ” - Bank

“Good hard fought dub” - CJ

Nooni vs CalAmari Cooper:

Prediction: CalAmari Cooper by 27.6

Reality: CalAmari Cooper by 29.88

“I don’t want to speak on those” - Nooni

“100+ without Kelce or Amari? I’m going to the championship” - Dmichs

Real Brothers vs Team ACL Tear:

Prediction: Team ACL Tear by 17.6

Reality: Team ACL Tear by 47.72

“Happy to be one step closer to the coveted roto trophy. Yikes Jart” - JL

“Oof. Congrats to the Dolphins D, Broncos D, and Taylor Heinicke on scoring touchdowns this week for the family. Very happy for my opponent JL, he deserves the roto trophy and a 13-1 regular season, and he is well on his way to both” - Jart

Team Horses vs United Nations:

Prediction: United Nations by 3.6

Reality: Team Horses by 49.18

“My team is kind of like a shart. You never know what you’re gonna get, but you always hope for the best” - Folbe

“Couldn’t have had worse luck last week. Happy Folbe’s boys got 100000000000 touchdowns tho” - MW

GRIDDY GANG vs Mike Williams WR1:

Prediction: GRIDDY GANG by 62.5

Reality: Mike Williams WR1 by 46.34

“Rex burkhead deserved more run” - Jase

“It was bad news for Jason all day Sunday” - Brad

Transaction Analysis

Best Transaction: Dontrell Hilliard, $0, MW. Got an RB1 for nothing!

Honorable Mention: Cedrick Wilson, $2, Aross. Great flyer on a guy who popped, even if his long term outlook isn’t great.

Second Honorable Mention: Brandon McManus, $0, MW. Not because he was that amazing, but because MW finally moved on from Younghoe Koo.

Worst Transaction: Rex Burkhead, $7, Jase. There weren’t any terrible moves this week, but the most money spent last week on a RB who was average at best. Not that bad of a move though.

Honorable Mention: Robby Anderson, $0, Dmichs. Robby is having a ROUGH year.

No debating.

Worst Possible Lineup

QB: Cam Newton, 6.18 points, JL

RB: Aaron Jones, 2.3 points, Aross

RB: D’Andre Swift, 2.4 points, Jart

WR: DK Metcalf, 1.8 points, Aross

Would it have beaten Dwitt in 2019: Yep we stay nice

RB: JD McKissic, 20.1 points, Brad

How many teams would it have beaten this week: 11, everyone but Folbe

Record by Max PF

In this segment, we will be looking at what everyone’s record would be if we played best ball - where the higher max PF each week (best lineup) would win the H2H matchup even if those players were on the bench. *Record tiebreaker was by Max PF possible on season*

  1. JL (11-1) No Change
  2. CJ (7-5) No Change
  3. Dmichs (7-5) No Change
  4. NN (7-5) +1 Win
  5. Jart (6-6) No Change
  6. Bank (6-6) +1 Win
  7. Brad (6-6) +2 Wins
  8. Aross (6-6) -1 Win
  9. Folbe (5-7) -2 Wins
  10. Jason (4-8) -1 Win
  11. MW (4-8) No Change
  12. Nooni (3-9) No Change

League Takes

Agree:

-Glad I traded Chuba 🤡

-League has cool guys go blue

-Nooni is so nice

-Once again- roto is the best way to run the league. Absolutely electric weeks coming up

-Excited for the playoffs

Neutral:

-Someone sitting in the playoffs today will not be in come 2 weeks from Monday

-Lopas losing in the semifinals of playoffs

-Seems the playoffs are basically all set now

-Dmichs wins the league with some hot performances in the playoffs

Disagree:

-Roto should decide first round byes next year

Returning Segment: Trade Jartalyzer

Trade #1:

Aross: Keenan Allen, Jamison Crowder (Grade: A-)

Folbe: Tee Higgins, DK Metcalf (Grade: B-)

This really is not a terrible trade for either team, but Aross gets the potential for two starting WRs with high upside while Folbe really only gets one. Tee popping and DK struggling will likely not be the norm, and Allen provides an elite floor in production, but I think Alex got the better deal here.

Trade #2:

Aross: Antonio Brown, Myles Gaskin (Grade: B+)

Bank: Aaron Jones (Grade: A)

While week one certainly favored Bank, and will again this week with Aaron Jones on bye, the deal is not terrible for Aross either. Gaskin has been extremely sporadic, AB continues to deal with injury, and Aaron Jones has incredible upside. Alex needed some guys who can go get 40 to have a shot, and no shame in going and getting one.

Jart’s Mailbag

Who is the most likely league member to go broke?

Gotta feel like it’s CJ with the size of his units in gambling. Certainly not Brad. Sneaky pick? MW once Peloton closes up shop.

With all the injuries to running backs taken in spots 1-4 of this years draft, are these spots going to be seen as valuable next year? Or is there a change coming?

While it is certainly noteworthy, I still expect that we’ll see 4 RBs go right away along with more following, unless we were to make a change to our league structure in terms of roster or scoring. I think of a guy like Austin Ekeler who missed a lot of time last year, but is RB2 this year. RBs just remain too valuable currently to go in any other direction.

Will cmac go in the 10th round or undrafted next year?

Good question MW, I can tell you’re feeling scorned. Despite the season he had this year with injuries, and the history he has formed, he is way too talented when healthy to fall out of the first round in my opinion. Similar to a Saquon but with more proof of production.

Predicted first round of next year’s fantasy draft?

  1. Jonathan Taylor
  2. Austin Ekeler
  3. Derrick Henry
  4. Najee Harris
  5. Joe Mixon
  6. Ezekiel Elliott
  7. Dalvin Cook
  8. Alvin Kamara
  9. Christian McCaffrey
  10. Leonard Fournette
  11. Aaron Jones
  12. Travis Kelce

What is your projected playoff bracket?

  1. Jonah
  2. CJ
  3. Dmichs
  4. Folbe
  5. Alex
  6. Jart

What NFL player would you choose to wingman for you, and why?

Definitely Tyler LockettE. Not the most intimidating guy in the world which is a plus, and you know we are on that same path that Daniel Banooni really supports and loves.

Rank the league members in competitive eating?

  1. Alex
  2. Brad
  3. Dmichs
  4. Folbe
  5. CJ
  6. JL
  7. NN
  8. Jason
  9. Nooni
  10. Jart
  11. Bank
  12. MW

Top 5 favorite dum-dums flavors?

Had to google this one, because I never eat them. So this is more of a guess:

  1. Cream Soda
  2. Chocolate
  3. Black Cherry
  4. Blue Raspberry
  5. Watermelon

In what year does someone leave the league?

CJ every offseason, but he’ll be back by July. In all honesty, I don’t see anyone leaving anytime soon. Nooni does feel like the most likely candidate if I had to pick, but I certainly hope he stays!

Does this league make it to 2030?

Easily.

Is Alex going to make the playoffs?

ESPN has him as a 74% chance currently, and that’s pretty fair, but slightly lower because of roto 6 seed. It seems like the 5 seed is going to come down to Alex-NN, and Alex certainly has the record advantage right now, so I see it as 60% Alex, 40% NN.

How’s everyone feelin after T-givey?

CJ I don’t know if you want me to just guess how everyone is doing, but I will!

CJ: Dude’s chillin, loving life, loving his squad

NN: Making a phone call to Tomlin to talk about Najee’s usage, he’s doing well

Brad: Hyped to finally get to spend time with his dad in Indy

Alex: Interviewing to be the Padres next manager as we speak

JL: Feeling invincible after getting his girlfriend sick

Jase: Doing pretty solid, chillin

Dmichs: I have no idea.

Nooni: Now that he’s focused on things besides this league he’s doing better

Gart: Overtaking Bezos soon, or going to Anduril

MW: He’s still blacked, just like his team

Bank: Dude’s never been happier to be a Spartan after last Saturday. Go Green.

Jart: Overall great, a little nervy about his squad though

Looks like a lot of ugly lineups this week. Who’s the worst?

He very easily could win, but MW is looking ROUGH. He’s likely going to have to pick up a player from the waivers just to be able to fill his lineup, no McCaffrey or DJ Moore, no new star Dontrell Hilliard. Herbert-Jrob-Javonte is a solid trio, but Claypool-Green-who knows will be interesting. Could get ugly.

What do you think the score of a hypothetical Nebraska/Georgia game would be if it was played in Lincoln at night?

Well, it’d be a single score game, I’ll tell you that. Knowing Georgia’s defense and Logan Smothers, Nebraska would score 3 points tops. Based on this info, I’ll take Georgia 12-3.

What is a random non-fantasy football thought you had this week?

I was driving this week and I decided to shuffle my old music from Apple music back in the middle school days, and it did not disappoint. A couple of my takeaways from that time were that:

  1. A car ride with Do The John Wall, Rappers Delight, and Forever is not a bad car ride.
  2. We really did whatever we wanted in middle school. One time for science class I changed the words to Forever and wrote and performed a rap on soil erosion. Wild times.

Does your team feel like a Family right now?

Yes, if it was a dysfunctional family that kinda hated each other and did bad things just to spite each other. There’s a lot to figure out, and it’s been tough to parent.

On To Week Thirteen!

This Week’s Matchups:

Team Ross vs Team Horses: Two teams both in need of a win to feel more secure in their playoff standings, there’s a lot of familiar faces on opposing teams now following their trade last week. The matchup boasts two of the most electric QBs in the league in Lamar and Allen, along with some fun players in Mattison-Fournette-DK-Keenan. On paper Folbe seems to have a slight advantage in the RB2 and FLEX department, while the rest seems to be pretty even. A lot of players on both teams have turned in uneven performances making it somewhat difficult to predict, but Folbe seems like the safer pick, so we like Team Horses by 12.4.

Aross: “No comment at this time”

Folbe: “Alex’s roster resembles Frankenstein. Lot of pieces pulled together that somehow get the job done. Knowing that I traded him Tee and DK he’ll get the win against me. Good win”

I Got a Half Chubb vs Team ACL Tear: It just seems unwise to pick against JL right now, even with Deebo on bye. No Rodgers and Chubb certainly limit CJ’s upside, but both teams still look solid from the top to bottom. The return of Kyler Murray will be interesting to watch more for the longevity of JL’s team than anything, but right now I do not want to bet against Ekeler-Mixon-Lamb-Gronk. We like Team ACL Tear by 15.6.

JL: “Deebo out. GG CJ”

CJ: “Tough one with Jonah this week”

Nooni vs Mike Williams WR1: Brad is looking hot right now while Nooni may finish last in PF every week moving forward. Mahomes-Gibson-Cordarelle-Eli is looking really nice currently, while Nooni should have a bounceback week with Jamaal likely starting and Derek having a nice matchup. Additionally, Godwin and Evans should get back on track after horrendous weeks, while Gesicki draws a nice matchup too. I need to call an upset somewhere this week, and as karma for Brad declining my Mahomes-Gibson for Hurts-Chase offer, we like Nooni by 6.7.

Nooni: “I don’t want to speak on those”

Brad: “I got nooni? LOL”

Real Brothers vs United Nations: Both of these teams are truly bringing out their backups this week in what will truly be a war of attrition. Both teams will be missing big names (both in real life and in fantasy) this week between injuries and byes. There still remain a lot of question marks health wise that will dictate this matchup, but Jart seems to have slightly more depth than MW currently, and for that reason we like Real Brothers by 3.3, a result the whole league can get behind for Roto purposes.

Jart: “Who knows. It’s literally a guessing game every week with my team. Maybe we’ll do ok this week, maybe we won’t. Glad I have a roto cushion, although that may evaporate this week”

MW: “I hope Jart wins 😊”

NN vs CalAmari Cooper: NN needs this one badly to have a shot at the playoffs, while Dmichs is in a close race for the 2 seed and coveted first round bye. While there are a lot of factors here that could dictate, Jonathan Taylor facing Houston seems to be the trump card above all else. Projected an astronomical 22.8 points, he should easily surpass even the loftiest of expectations, and could put forth another 40+ point performance. Najee+Kupp+Diggs will certainly fight, but we like CalAmari Cooper by 11.5.

NN: “Good win DMichs, happy for you”

Dmichs: “This week I’m taking NN’s cheeks…then I’m gunna beat him in fantasy…pause”

GRIDDY GANG vs Pray For Ridley: More than a win, these teams need roto points to have a chance at the 6 seed. RB2 continues to be a major concern for Jase, but Rex Burkhead seems to be sliding back into the role this week unless Miles Sanders is unable to go (health of Kamara lingering). The FLEX here is perhaps the most entertaining piece, as it features two former superstars in Antonio Brown and OBJ. Both have nice matchups, but it is the consistency of James Conner, and Tom Brady getting back on track against a terrible Atlanta team, that we like to push Bank over the top and back into contention. We like Pray for Ridley by 5.4.

Bank: “Nooni is so nice”

Jase: “I need some points it’d be nice if Alvin Kamara can contribute”

Best Player at Each Position

QB: Lamar Jackson, Aross

RB: Jonathan Taylor, Dmichs

WR: Cooper Kupp, NN

TE: George Kittle, Brad

D/ST: Whoever JL starts

K: Matt Gay, Jase

Family Award

The winner of this award is Jonah, simply because he’s been content with what he has and the guys continue to produce. That’s a family forming over there through and through, with Mixon fitting in nicely.
